titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A hard frost with a slight snow–fall. Bitterly cold. At Lambeth all day, where I again "spoke unadvisedly with my lips", and drew odium upon myself. Gore was at his worst, & I "went for" him too roughly. At tea, the Abp. asked me about Lilley, as a possible Canon of Westminster. I spoke strongly in his favour.
